intro: Huernia volkartii, commonly known as the Volcár's horned cushion, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its dense, rounded clusters of fleshy, ribbed stems that resemble a cushion. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange during the warmer months. Its leaves are typically spine-tipped and arranged in a tight rosette pattern. Huernia volkartii is well adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick, fleshy stems.
